layer.name: Estimated intersection density of walkable roads
layer.eaDescription: This EnviroAtlas dataset estimates the intersection density of walkable roads within a 750 meter radius of any given 10 meter pixel in the community. Intersections are defined as any point where 3 or more roads meet and density is calculated using kernel density, where closer intersections are weighted higher than further intersections. Intersection density is highly correlated with walking for transportation.

fieldInfos.label: Estimated intersection density of walkable roads

popup.title: Estimated intersection density of walkable roads

layer.name: Number of day care centers
layer.eaDescription: This map shows the number of day care centers in each census block group.

layer.name: Number of schools (K-12)
layer.eaDescription: This map shows the number of K-12 schools in each census block group.

layer.name: Percent population other than White, non-Hispanic
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of the population of each census block group that did not identify as White Alone in 2010. This value includes white Hispanics.

fieldInfos.label: Percent population other than White, non-Hispanic

layer.name: Percent population over 70 years old
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of the population of each census block group aged 70 years or older in 2010.

layer.name: Percent population under 1 year old
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of the population of each census block group under one year of age in 2010.

layer.name: Percent population under 13 years old
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of the population of each census block group under 13 years of age in 2010.

layer.name: Percent population with income below twice the poverty level
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of the population of each census block group with income less than two times the relative household poverty level in 2010.

fieldInfos.label: Percent population with income below twice the poverty level

layer.name: Population other than White, non-Hispanic
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of individuals in each census block group that did not identify as White Alone in 2010. This value includes white Hispanics.

layer.name: Population over 70 years old
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of individuals in each census block group that were 70 years of age or older in 2010.

layer.name: Population under 1 year old
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of individuals in each census block group that were under one year of age in 2010.

layer.name: Population under 13 years old
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of individuals in each census block group that were under 13 years of age in 2010.

layer.name: Population with income below twice the poverty level
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of individuals in each census block group with income less than two times the relative household poverty level in 2010.

fieldInfos.label: Population with income below twice the poverty level

layer.name: Total Population [census block group]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the total population of each census block group in 2010.

layer.name: Dasymetric allocation of population
layer.eaDescription: This dasymetric population map intelligently reallocates 2010 population from census blocks to 30 meter pixels based on land cover and slope. It is used for metrics that require population to be spatially allocated at a pixel level, primarily in the urban section of the atlas.

layer.name: Employment diversity
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays a measure of employment diversity within each census block group. Job counts used in the equation are from eight employment categories: retail, office, service, industrial, entertainment, education, healthcare, and public administration.

layer.name: Employment Rate
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of the population aged 16-64 who have worked in the past 12 months by block group. It includes people who worked any number of hours per week.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

layer.name: Employment:housing ratio
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the jobs-to-housing balance (or total employment divided by total occupied housing units) within each census block group for 2010.

layer.name: Jobs within a 45-minute drive, weighted
layer.eaDescription: This map indicates the relative accessibility to jobs from residences via automobile (in terms of street network travel time) for each census block group, compared to other block groups in the same metropolitan region. Jobs in nearby block groups (based on travel time) are weighted more heavily than those further away.

layer.name: Number of high-wage workers [work location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of workers earning more than $3333 per month summarized by workplace location within each census block group.

layer.name: Number of households
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the number of households (i.e., occupied housing units) within each census block group in 2010. A household consists of all people who occupy a housing unit regardless of relationship. See user guide for details: https:

layer.name: Number of households with zero vehicles

fieldInfos.label: Number of households with zero vehicles

layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the number of households without vehicles within each census block group in 2010. The word vehicle refers to private motor vehicles such as cars and trucks.

layer.name: Number of low-wage workers [home location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of workers earning $1250 or less per month summarized by residence within each census block group.

layer.name: Number of low-wage workers [work location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of workers earning $1250 or less per month summarized by workplace location within each census block group.

layer.name: Number of middle-wage workers [work location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of workers earning between $1250 and $3333 per month summarized by workplace location within each census block group.

layer.name: Number of workers [home location]
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the total number of workers by home location in 2010 within each census block group.

layer.name: Pedestrian-oriented street intersection density
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the degree of pedestrian-oriented street connectivity for each census block group, measured as street intersections per square mile. Intersections that exclude pedestrian passage were not counted.

layer.name: Percent 25 Years And Over With A High School Degree

fieldInfos.label: Percent 25 Years And Over With A High School Degree

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of population 25 years and over with a high school degree by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Percent 25 Years And Over With Less Than A High School Degree

fieldInfos.label: Percent 25 Years And Over With Less Than A High School Degree

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of population 25 years and over with less than a high school degree by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Percent Age Less Than 18 Years Old

fieldInfos.label: Percent Age Less Than 18 Years Old

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of population less than 18 years old by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Percent Age Less Than 5 Years Old

fieldInfos.label: Percent Age Less Than 5 Years Old

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of population less than 5 years old by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Percent Below Poverty Level
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of population below poverty level by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Percent Housing Units Built Before 1950
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of housing units built before 1950 by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Percent Linguistically Isolated Households
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of population living in linguistically isolated households by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Percent Low Income Population (Less Than 2X Poverty Level)

fieldInfos.label: Percent Low Income Population (Less Than 2X Poverty Level)

layer.eaDescription: This map service layer displays percent of population considered "low income" by census tract. "Low income" in this layer is defined as income in the previous 12 months that is less than 2 times the poverty level considering household composition and family size. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008-2012).

layer.name: Percent Minority
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of minority population by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Percent of households with zero vehicles

fieldInfos.label: Percent of households with zero vehicles

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates zero-vehicle households as a percentage of all households within each census block group in 2010. The word vehicle refers to private motor vehicles such as cars and trucks.

layer.name: Percent low-wage workers [work location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percentage of all workers within each census block group earning $1250 or less per month based on their workplace location.

layer.name: Percent of workers who bike or walk to work

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who bike or walk to work

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who bike or walk to work.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

layer.name: Percent of workers who carpool to work

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who carpool to work

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who carpool to work.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

layer.name: Percent of workers who commute to work by public transportation

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who commute to work by public transportation

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who commute to work by public transportation.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

layer.name: Percent of workers who drive to work alone

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who drive to work alone

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who drive to work alone.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

layer.name: Percent of workers who work from home

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who work from home

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who work from home.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

layer.name: Percent of workers with 30 - 60 minutes travel time to work

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers with 30 - 60 minutes travel time to work

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers within each block group with travel time to work ranging from 30 to 60 minutes.

layer.name: Percent of workers with 60 - 90 minutes travel time to work

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers with 60 - 90 minutes travel time to work

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers within each block group with travel time to work ranging from 60 to 90 minutes.

layer.name: Percent of workers with greater than 90 minutes travel time to work

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers with greater than 90 minutes travel time to work

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers within each block group with more than 90 minutes travel time to work.

layer.name: Percent of workers with less than 30 minutes travel time to work

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers with less than 30 minutes travel time to work

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers within each block group with less than 30 minutes travel time to work.

layer.name: Percent Population Age Greater Than 64 Years Old

fieldInfos.label: Percent Population Age Greater Than 64 Years Old

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of population greater than 64 years old by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Population Density (per square mile)
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates population density (per square mile) by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Population of American Indian and Alaskan Native

fieldInfos.label: Population of American Indian and Alaskan Native

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of American Indians and Alaskan Natives by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Population of American Indian and Alaskan Native Below Poverty Level

fieldInfos.label: Population of American Indian and Alaskan Native Below Poverty Level

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of American Indians and Alaskan Natives below poverty level by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Residential density (hu/ac)
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates residential density (or housing units per acre) within each census block group. Developed acreage is calculated by excluding parks, water bodies, conservation easements, and other protected areas.

layer.name: Total employment
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the total number of jobs in 2010 within each census block group.

layer.name: Total housing units
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the number of housing units (both occupied and vacant) within each census block group in 2010. A housing unit is any living quarters, such as a house, apartment, or mobile home.

layer.name: Total Population
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates total population by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2008 - 2012).

layer.name: Transit service per hour during evening peak

fieldInfos.label: Transit service per hour during evening peak

layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the aggregate frequency of public transit service (trips per hour) in each census block group. Frequency reflects service during weekday afternoon peak commute period (4:00–7:00 pm).

layer.name: Workers per job  - Equilibrium Index
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates an index that measures the balance between workers and jobs within each census block group. An index value close to one indicates a balance between resident workers and jobs.

layer.name: Working age population within a 45-minute drive, weighted

fieldInfos.label: Working age population within a 45-minute drive, weighted

layer.eaDescription: This map indicates the relative accessibility to working age populations (residences) from employment locations via auto commute (in terms of street-network travel time) for each census block group. People living in nearby block groups (based on travel time) are weighted more heavily than those further away.

layer.name: Employment density (jobs/ac)
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates employment density (or jobs per acre) within each census block group. Developed acreage is calculated by excluding parks, water bodies, conservation easements, and other protected areas.

layer.name: Business address vacancy rate for 2014
layer.eaDescription: This map displays the percentage of business addresses that had remained vacant for more than one year in 2014. This layer is based on the United States Postal Service (USPS) Vacant Address Data.

layer.name: Change in business vacancy rate from 2010-2014, in percentage points

fieldInfos.label: Change in business vacancy rate from 2010-2014, in percentage points

layer.eaDescription: This map displays the change in the business vacancy rate from 2010-2014 in percentage points (2014 rate minus 2010 rate). This layer is based on the United States Postal Service (USPS) Vacant Address Data. Vacant buildings are included if they remained vacant for more than one year.

layer.name: Residential address vacancy rate for 2014
layer.eaDescription: This map displays the percentage of residential addresses that had remained vacant for more than one year in 2014. This layer is based on the United States Postal Service (USPS) Vacant Address Data.

layer.name: Change in residential vacancy rate from 2010-2014, in percentage points

fieldInfos.label: Change in residential vacancy rate from 2010-2014, in percentage points

layer.eaDescription: This map displays the change in the residential vacancy rate from 2010-2014 in percentage points (2014 rate minus 2010 rate). This layer is based on the United States Postal Service (USPS) Vacant Address Data. Vacant buildings are included if they remained vacant for more than one year.

layer.name: Percentage of households with incomes above twice the poverty line and below $75,000

fieldInfos.label: Percentage of households with incomes above twice the poverty line and below $75,000

layer.eaDescription: Percentage of households with incomes above twice the poverty line ($30,000) and below $75,000 in the past 12 months (2008-2012).

layer.name: Percentage of households with incomes above $75,000 and below $200,000

fieldInfos.label: Percentage of households with incomes above $75,000 and below $200,000

layer.eaDescription: Percentage of households with incomes above $75,000 and below $200,000 in the past 12 months (2008-2012)

layer.name: Percentage of households with incomes above $200,000.

fieldInfos.label: Percentage of households with incomes above $200,000.

layer.eaDescription: Percentage of households with incomes above $200,000 in the past 12 months (2008-2012)

layer.name: Percentage of households below the quality of life threshold income

fieldInfos.label: Percentage of households below the quality of life threshold income

layer.eaDescription: Percentage of households below the adjusted quality of life threshold income for their county (2008-2012). The threshold is the average optimal household income for quality of life, adjusted to reflect county cost of living.

layer.name: Threshold income for quality of life

fieldInfos.label: Threshold income for quality of life

layer.eaDescription: Threshold income for quality of life (household), based on national value adjusted to reflect county cost of living (2008-2012).

layer.name: Population [12-digit HUC]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the total population that lives in each 12-digit HUC for 2010.

layer.name: Brownfield Grantee (ACRES)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Brownfields: Shows only points from the Assessment, Cleanup and Redevelopment Exchange System (ACRES) grantee reported data on environmental activities and accomplishments (assessment, cleanup and redevelopment), funding, job training, and details on cooperative partners and leveraging efforts - a central objective of the Brownfields Program.

layer.name: Integrated Compliance Information System-Air (ICIS-Air)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Air Pollution: The air pollution data (ICIS-AIR, ICIS-AIR Major) contains compliance and permit data for stationary sources of air pollution (such as electric power plants, steel mills, factories, and universities) regulated by EPA, state and local air pollution agencies.

layer.name: Integrated Compliance Information System-Air Major (ICIS-Air Major)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Air Pollution: The air pollution data (ICIS-AIR, ICIS-AIR Major) contains compliance and permit data for stationary sources of air pollution (such as electric power plants, steel mills, factories, and universities) regulated by EPA, state and local air pollution agencies.

layer.name: Air Quality System (AIRS AQS)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Air Pollution: The air pollution data (ICIS-AIR, ICIS-AIR Major) contains compliance and permit data for stationary sources of air pollution (such as electric power plants, steel mills, factories, and universities) regulated by EPA, state and local air pollution agencies.

layer.name: Permitted Water Dischargers
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Water Dischargers: Includes permit information from the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) which controls water pollution by regulating sources, such as municipal and industrial wastewater treatment facilities, that discharge pollutants into waters of the United States.

layer.name: Permitted Water Dischargers - Major
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Active
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Inactive
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Large Quantity Generators (LQG)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Transporters
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Superfund
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Superfund (SEMS) and SEMS NPL: Includes the National Priorities List (NPL) among the known releases or threatened releases of hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants throughout the United States and its territories.

layer.name: Superfund - National Priorites List (NPL)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Superfund (SEMS) and SEMS NPL: Includes the National Priorities List (NPL) among the known releases or threatened releases of hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants throughout the United States and its territories.

layer.name: Toxic Release Inventory (TRI)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Toxic Releases: The Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) contains information on toxic chemical releases and waste management activities reported annually by certain industries as well as federal facilities.
